TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit AddTaskCollectionResultHandler extends Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior

Docs.summary: A which you can use to specify under what conditions an operation to add multiple tasks to a job should retry, terminate or be considered successful.
Docs.remarks: You do not need to specify this behavior explicitly; if you do not, a default behavior is used. This behavior uses the criteria.

Docs.param: A function that defines whether a particular Add Task operation is considered successful or unsuccessful, and whether it may be retried.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified result handler function.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.Azure.Batch.AddTaskResultStatus DefaultAddTaskCollectionResultHandler (Microsoft.Azure.Batch.AddTaskResult addTaskResult, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken);

.method public static hidebysig valuetype Microsoft.Azure.Batch.AddTaskResultStatus DefaultAddTaskCollectionResultHandler(class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.AddTaskResult addTaskResult, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed

Docs.param: The result of a single Add Task operation.
The cancellation token associated with the AddTaskCollection operation.
Docs.summary: The default result handler for the behavior. This handler treats success and 'TaskExists' errors as successful, retries server errors (HTTP 5xx), and throws on client error (HTTP 4xx).
Docs.returns: An which indicates whether the is classified as a success or as requiring a retry.
